comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Dr. Charles William Dabney (1855-1945) was an 1877 graduate of the University of Virginia. From 1887 to 1904 he was President of the University of Tennessee, and from 1904 to 1920 President of the University of Cincinnati. In 1893 he was named to be Assistant Secretary of Agriculture by U.S. President Grover Cleveland. Here's a painting of him in 1919 from the Tennessee Portrait Project. A collection of his papers can be found at the University of Tennessee Special Collections Library in Knoxville.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: In April 1913 (date on sticker: 4/8/13), he was slated for the position of chief of the Weather Bureau. He was a candidate for the position of Secretary of Agriculture before, see The Washington times., April 17, 1913, LAST AND HOME EDITION, Image 1, with photo.
